forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 51. West southwest wind 8 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 7 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph.

weather_report:
As the clock gently ticks into the evening, Downtown San Francisco unfurls under a blanket of soft, floating clouds. The air carries a coolness reminiscent of a gentle sea breeze, with promising hints of warmth lingered in the promised sunshine of the morrow. Tonight's low settles around a refreshing fifty-one degrees, complemented by the whispers of a west-southwest wind that dances lightly, ensuring that any lingering humidity dissipates, leaving the coastal scent sharp and invigorating.

Tomorrow, the city awakens under an aura of optimism with mostly sunny skies enveloping the landscape. The anticipated high, reaching near sixty-two, will embrace the afternoon with a subtle drop in temperature, as clouds may nestle again into the folds of the horizon. Gusts may tussle the hair, climbing to approximately twenty-four miles per hour, so venturing outdoors would benefit from layers—a light sweater or jacket to accommodate both the warmth of midday and the gentle coolness of evening. 

As fog lingers in the crevices, its ethereal presence grants the city a dreamlike quality appealing for quiet strolls along the waterfront or intimate coffee gatherings in cozy cafés. The tranquil ambiance of dusk gives way to opportunities to enjoy a leisurely evening stroll, perhaps across the iconic boardwalk of Embarcadero or through the historic streets of North Beach, where the essence of the city merges with the rhythm of life, creating an experience akin to savoring the rich notes of a fine wine.
